Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2010 05:03AM juliaw wrote: OH MY Duman, Stay strong and know your daughter loves you.  I was just diagnosed Tuesday.  We have told my 13 year old son.  He has been very quiet but had a stomach ache yesterday.  He never has tummy aches.  My eight year old daughter is at camp. I pick her up today.  I am dreading telling her.  I know she will be more emotional and I do not want her memory of camp be that mommy got sick while she was gone.  Also my sugery is scheduled for the 8th.  Her birthday is the 6th.  I am trying to figure out how to make the 6th about her birthday not my illness.
Posts.Title: Any Mums with Teens/Young Kids? frangipangi juliaw

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 09:44AM juliaw wrote: Hi, Where do I find out about Penguin COld Caps?  I have never heard of this.  I had my bilaterla masectomy Thursday and had a tumor in one sentinal node so we know I will  have chemo.  I am waiting on the patholoy for the rest of the nodes. I am PR and ER + and HER -.  I am meeting with the oncologist next week to work out my treatment plan and I am nervous about the chemo
